intro: Gilia tenuiflora var. exilis, commonly known as the slenderflower gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its small, lance-shaped leaves and showy blooms make it a distinctive species in its habitat. It is often found in open areas such as hillsides and dry streambeds.
